title: Can we agree on this being unhealthy?

BT provides damage, lifesteal and a defensive passive (shield). It is quite similar to DD in this respect.
I think that granting defense or sustain that scales off offensive stats will prove difficult to balance.
I'm talking about lifesteal. Draven with lifesteal can effectively drain tank better than Vladimir. 

Burst damage is complained about a lot, but without it, ADC's like Draven could quite literally 1v3, as they would quickly heal up damage which they receive. On the other hand, an actual tank stat, health regen, is hardly noticeable when compared to lifesteal and is being phased out into a support stat.

I just think lifesteal is an extremely frustrating mechanic to play against when it's so powerful that 4 auto attacks can restore a low ADC to full HP, rendering previous attempts to damage said ADC useless.

Draven has always been too good early for how good he is late. If you know what you're doing on him you can still be super effective late game with the guy. Wth is it fair to have such a great late game on a champ who's early/mid game is the best in the role? While some champs gotta suffer soooo much early just to be good late.

I love how no one said a word about Draven for years but Riot buffs an item that makes him insanely strong and suddenly he's horribly designed and needs nerfs and everything. It couldn't possible be the item that even some Jhin players build first that is making him strong.

Complaints coming out of nowhere is what the Gameplay Board is all about, but I'd argue it is reasonable for Draven balance discussion to show up so suddenly. Draven puts out constant threat of becoming FOTM in almost every patch, and it finally happened because he received both a direct buff and an item buff.

Why do you think there were threads on these Boards every few weeks asking why he doesn't become a favorable pick? You know, after those patches that buffed AD during an ADC-focused high damage meta. Was it because they wanted him to be strong, or because they were scared of him coming out and fucking up game balance?

No one spoke about his kit's balance because with Draven the only topic that came to mind was whether or not he is viable. If he was actually discussed properly the "high skillcap" meme would be exposed for what it is -- something that warps players' perception of the kit's output and leads players to not question its issues.  
Add to that how he isn't played over other picks in a role that's dominated by certain champions constantly, and you've got a champion that everyone forgets until it's too late.

Okay, here's how to shut down Draven 101.

Without Q - Spinning Axe, Draven's damage is **garbage**. If you can properly play around this CD and mechanic of catching axes, Draven is much easier to deal with. 

Because of the point above, Draven struggles **heavily** against reliable CC. Many supports can punish aggressive Dravens for catching axes in your face while trading, while others can prevent him from catching axes at all, simultaneously reducing his damage output greatly. 

Heavy sustain lanes, and greater range, can outsustain Draven's mana pool. Champions like Caitlyn, Jinx, and Ashe can trade well from a distance while typically all running Warlord's Bloodlust, forcing Draven to epend more mana during trades for mobility. These champions also have decent zone control, making harder to do Draven things.

Remember, short trades (1-2 autos) will almost always be in Draven's favor, but extended trades/kiting will wear down any Draven. 

Finally, Draven has to get a kill to cash in on stacks. If you force extended laning while not handing over first blood, you completely negate the entire reason behind the Draven pick. 

He has a good win rate but an extremely low pick rate (on NA, at least). Caitlyn has a very, very high pick rate while maintaining a win rate within 1% of Draven.

This is actually a problem I see with the Boards a lot. The complaints are too short sighted. Blind Pick in ranked had its problems, but with pick order there was at least some solution to the problem (even if it wasnt perfect). But there were ton of complaints about not having role selection in Ranked - when it was implemented, people complained that Secondary Supports and Fill got you support 99% of the time. So that complaint was addressed through autofill - but then autofill is the problem. 

In this case, its the support. Earlygame bot pressure is most often determined by the support. Draven, though strong early, still falls under the ADC problem in lane - having to juggle CS, harass, and dodging abilities of 2 champions with only 1 potion. Strong harassing supports can punish a Draven and keep him in line for the early part of the game while he catches axes, get your ADC enough farm to buy items, then transition into teamfights where Draven's auto-attack reliant, single-target damage becomes a liability. But people complained about the strength of those supports like Brand or Zyra. Well, when you nerf those supports, you have to realize that ADCs who can take over a lane (Draven) or ADCs that arent so good at laning but scale super well (Twitch) are going to get indirectly buffed.

I've always found Draven irritating. I'm glad he's getting a bloody good smacking around on the Boards, because I'm just tired of him. Even when his pickrate was garbage, I found his design was one of the most annoying ever to play against.
